alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 07 at 2:00PM CDT until July 10 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Dodge City KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County. For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Crooked Creek Near Englewood. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding along most streches of Crooked Creek in southern Meade County. Both riverbanks will experience inundations up to 2 feet as the floodwaters continue their expansion onto the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CDT Friday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 7.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 7.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage Monday morning to 5.2 feet Tuesday evening. It will then rise to 5.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 05/01/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
